page.title: 13BERGHOLT-THE LAST 60 YEARS
page.content: {A LIFETIME} WEST BERGHOLT 1925 A COMMUNITY WITH THE CHURCH,CHAPEL AND SCHOOL AS THE FOCAL POINTS. NOTABLES WERE THE DOCTOR,DISTRICT NURSE,POLICEMAN AND VARIOUS TRADESMEN. THE MAIN EMPLOYERS WERE THE LAND- OWNING GENTRY,FARMERS AND BREWERY.THE WORKERS LIVED WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF WORK,IN A TIED OR RENTED COTTAGE. CHILDREN RAISED UNDER THESE CIRCUMSTANCEES WERE HAPPY AND SECURE BECAUSE THEY KNEW OF NOTHING BEYOND TO UNSETTLE THEM.MANUAL WORKERS HAD NO ANNUAL HOLIDAY SO THEY SELDOM HAD THE TIME,OPPORTUNITY OR MONEY TO ESCAPE THIS ENVIRONMENT. 1939 WORLD WAR 2 BROUGHT CHANGES TO VILLAGE LIFE THAT WERE IRREVOCABLE. MANY THAT LEFT DID NOT WANT TO RETURN TO PREVIOUS SITUATIONS.
